mapper.insert: INSERT INTO grapeems_user (userName, userSex, userAge, userEmail, userPassword, userProvince, userCity, userCommunity, userInterTime, userState, userRole, deptId, roleId) VALUES (#{userName}, #{userSex}, #{userAge}, #{userEmail}, #{userPassword}, #{userProvince}, #{userCity}, #{userCommunity}, #{userInterTime}, #{userState}, #{userRole}, #{deptId}, #{roleId})
mapper.delete: update grapeems_user set isDeleted = 0 where userId = #{userId}
mapper.select: select u.userId, u.userName, u.userSex, u.userAge, d.deptName, r.roleName, u.userEmail, u.userProvince, u.userCity, u.userCommunity, u.userInterTime, u.userState from grapeems_user u, grapeems_dept d, grapeems_role r where u.deptId = d.deptId and u.roleId = r.roleId and u.isDeleted = 1
select * from grapeems_user where userEmail = #{userEmail} and isDeleted = 1

select u.userId, u.userName, u.userSex, u.userAge, d.deptName, r.roleName, u.userEmail, u.userProvince, u.userCity, u.userCommunity, u.userInterTime, u.userState from grapeems_user u, grapeems_dept d, grapeems_role r where u.deptId = d.deptId and u.roleId = r.roleId and u.isDeleted = 1 and u.userId = #{userId}
select count(*) from grapeems_user where deptId = #{deptId} and isDeleted = 1
select count(*) from grapeems_user where isDeleted = 1
